thread.title_full: Calgary Flames shut out NHL's Colorado Avalanche | Flames | Hockey | Sports | To

author: torontosun.com
title: Calgary Flames shut out NHL's Colorado Avalanche | Flames | Hockey | Sports | To
text:
The last time he was spotted on the highlight shows, he had lost his shoes.
Just in case their was any concern that Calgary Flames winger Jiri Hudler had also lost his scoring touch ... He hasn't.
Hudler tallied twice in Tuesday's 2-0 exhibition victory over the Colorado Avalanche at the Saddledome, a good sign as he tries to build on a career-best offensive campaign that was capped by a shoeless (and hilarious) acceptance speech as the 2015 Lady Byng Memorial Trophy winner.
The national anthem was likely still echoing in the rafters when Hudler opened the scoring Tuesday. He and linemate Johnny Gaudreau played keepaway with the puck on their first shift, with Hudler finishing off a dandy give-and-go by cranking a one-timer over Calvin Pickard's shoulder just 24 seconds after puck-drop.
Hudler's second of the night was a tap-in. After fanning on his shot attempt from the slot, Flames newbie Michael Frolik slid a pass to his Czech countryman, who was parked at the post for an easy finish.
Frolik, who signed a five-year, US$21.5-million deal with the Flames on Canada Day, has hit the scoresheet in each of his three pre-season appearances with his new squad — totalling two goals and two assists.
Tuesday's contest didn't do much to help solve the Flames' goaltending conundrum, with Jonas Hiller and Karri Ramo splitting a shutout against a roster than better resembles the Avs' affiliate in San Antonio.
Hiller made 15 saves as the starter, while Ramo stopped all 14 shots fired his direction.
All that remains on the Flames' pre-season slate is a home-and-home set against the Winnipeg Jets, starting with Thursday's meeting at MTS Centre.
wes.gilbertson@sunmedia.ca
www.twitter.com/SUNGilbertson
3 STARS
Flames RW Jiri Hudle r — Star right-winger scored twice, but he'll save his hat-tricks for the regular season.
Flames C/W Sam Bennett — Played some wing. Played some centre. And looked pretty darn good at both.
Flames C/W Drew Shore — Among the bubble boys at forward, he made the best case on this night.
Colorado Avalanche at Calgary Flames
TIME: 7 p.m.
TV: None
RADIO: Sportsnet 960 The FAN
LIVE BLOG: Right here. Follow below this story. Mobile users can click here .
THE MAIN STORYLINE: Game 6 of the pre-season for the Flames, who are dressing a lineup that will be fairly close to what we can expect for the Oct. 7 home opener. But with three games remaining in the exhibition slate, we'll be soon getting to the short strokes.
LINEUP NOTES: Calgary will skate last season's top trio of Johnny Gaudreau, Sean Monahan and Jiri Hudler, at least to start the game before the mixing begins.
Among the bubble boys in the lineup are forwards Markus Granlund, Paul Byron, Drew Shore and Garnet Hathaway and defenceman Ryan Wilson.
Jonas Hiller is to start in goal but give way to Karri Ramo.
The Avs are bringing a rather no-name group, with Nathan MacKinnon the headliner, local product Conner Bleackley and former Flames Reto Berra and Blake Coumeau.
(NOTE: The Avalanche announced in the afternoon that Curtis Glencross - the former Flames left-winger, who is with them on a tryout basis - will indeed be part of the lineup in Calgary.)
BURNING QUESTION: Now that the big wave of cuts have been made by the Flames, who now is able to pull away from the pack battling for the sixth and seventh defenceman spots and fourth-line and 13th/14th forwards?
PLAYERS TO WATCH:
Avalanche: Conner Bleackley is a High River native who is also captain of the WHL's Red Deer Rebels and a 2014 first-round draft choice.
Flames: Sam Bennett is slated to start on the left wing on a line with Mikael Backlund and Michael Frolik but move to centre at some point in the game.
Flames Lines
FORWARDS
Johnny Gaudreau-Sean Monahan -Jiri Hudler
Sam Bennett-Mikael Backlund-Michael Frolik
Micheal Ferland-Markus Granlund-Josh Jooris
Paul Byron-Drew Shore-Garnet Hathaway
DEFENCE
Mark Giordano-Dougie Hamilton
Kris Russell-Dennis Wideman
Ryan Wilson-Deryk Engelland
GOAL
Jonas Hiller
Karri Ramo
Flames beat Avalanche 2-0 in pre-season matchup
